column1: See instructions for details on how to complete this template
column5: When did the relevant benefit crystallisation event take place? (XX/XX/XXXX)
column6: What was the type of relevant benefit crystallisation event? (see instructions)
column7: What was the total of the relevant benefit crystallisation event? (£)
column8: Does the member hold valid protection or enhancement for the relevant benefit crystallisation event? (YES/NO)
column9: IF NO TO H, GO TO COL. S
column10: Was any protection relied upon for the relevant benefit crystallisation event? (see instructions)
column11: IF YES to COL. J.: What is the associated protection or enhancement reference?
column12: If  any other protections or enhancements were relied upon, use COLS. M-Q
column13: For non-residence enhancement, what is the unique reference?
column14: For pension credits from previously crystallised rights enhancement, what is the unique reference?
column16: For recognised overseas pension scheme transfer enhancement, what is the unique reference?
column17: Was scheme specific lump sum protection relied upon? (YES/NO)
column18: Has this lump sum payment taken the member over their available lump sum and death benefit allowance? (YES/NO)
column19: IF NO TO COL. Q: Has this lump sum payment taken the member over their available lump sum allowance? (YES/NO)
column20: IF NO TO COL. R. JOURNEY ENDS
column21: IF YES TO COLS. Q or R: Has the excess been taxed at marginal rate for this member? (YES/NO)
column22: IF NO TO COL. T. JOURNEY ENDS
column23: What is the employer PAYE reference used to report the excess for this member?
